Description: Fragment of a mould-made pottery lid, probably of a lamp or thymiaterion, with a narrow turned-out rim and decorated with groups of semicircles and raised points. Traces of pink post-firing colour remain, perhaps rose madder. Traces of white coating. Brown Nile silt fabric with abundant mica, organics and white (limestone) inclusions <1mm.
Curator's comments: Parallel from Herakleopolis Magna (Petrie 1905, pl.58, no. K.10). Petrie, W.M.Fl. 1905, Roman Ehnasya (Herakleopolis Magna), 1904, London.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q566.bis)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KD.033) (Phase 1)
